intro: Pedicularis crenulata subsp. candida, commonly known as the white lady's slipper, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its distinctive white, hooded flowers that resemble a slipper. The plant is hemiparasitic, deriving some of its nutrients from the roots of neighboring plants. It thrives in moist, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous areas. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
